data.title: A Great Night Out
data.text: The delicious small plates freshly made and should be shared.   Friendly and helpful personal service.

data.title: Great from start to finish
data.text: This was my third visit in three years while visiting the area. They have never failed. Having grown up in South Florida, we know Cuban food. Everything from the beet salad with fried cheese to the roasted cauliflower to the large garlic shrimp to the pork ribs to the beef empanada was fresh, vibrant and mouth-watering. The plantains and yucca are the real deal. The plates are tapas style and come out as they are prepared so don't expect a conventional meal if you're not familiar with this type of cuisine. About four small plates is the right size for two people. Prices are reasonable and the service is quite good. Parking is available on the street and behind the building.

data.title: Excellent food, creative menu, and a great atmosphere
data.text:
My parents were visiting recently, and I stumbled across Gustazo on TripAdvisor after just casually browsing for restaurants. Everyone was up for something a bit more exciting and different than our typical French/Italian fine dining restaurants, and boy did we get it here. We ended up mostly ordering lots of small plates so we could try the biggest variety of dishes, and everything was delightful. Presentation was nice, every dish was unique, and yet everything hit its own mark perfectly. The small plates really are pretty small, but that just means you get to try more! The bacon-wrapped plantains and PEI mussels may have been my two favorites, but there's certainly a lot to choose from. 

Although the entree plates were on the small side, the desserts were anything but. Make sure you leave plenty of room! For something unlike any dessert I've ever had, try the Boniatio root. The dulce de leche crepes were phenomenal as well. 

The service was friendly and efficient, and the restaurant is in a very cool space, nicely decorated and well-lit. If anything, it was a little on the loud side, but I thought that just added to a fun, relaxed atmosphere. 

The only drawback to be aware of is a temporary one- since they don't have a liquor license yet, there aren't any fun Caribbean cocktails to complement the meal. However, we were told they expected to have that sorted out before the holidays, so I am looking forward to returning and seeing what the creative minds in the kitchen can do with a full bar!

data.title: Wow!
data.text: Love this place! I met a friend here and the two of us ordered three small plates to share, and a large plate each. It was way too much food, however I was glad to try several menu items. Everything was excellent and beautifully presented! Plus the waitstaff is friendly and professional, and the atmosphere is nice and casual, just perfect. Prices reasonable for what you get. There's plenty of parking in a public lot just behind the restaurant. Highly recommended!

data.title: The best Cuban cuisine in Greater Boston
data.text:
Visited this place after reading the raving reviews it has got. All are absolutely right! This place is really wonderful. There is a very broad selection from different dishes. If you are still not used to the XXXXXL size of US restaurants, don't worry, they have a selection of tapas, and eating two of them leaves you please.
And they also have an ample selection for vegetarians, vegans and celiacs.

data.title: Sumptuous dinners all around
data.text: Our group of 6 was treated to wonderfully prepared Cuban dishes. The big hits were the Puerco Asado (slow roasted pork, caramelized onions, rice, black beans, maduros) and the Mariscada (seafood stew in a coconut milk-cilantro sauce with scallops, shrimp, calamari, PEI mussels & clams). Service was friendly but understaffed with long periods of time trying to flag down a server. No alcohol is served which is not a problem. The meals are a bit pricey.

data.title: Completely Agree!
data.text: Dinner. Two couples. We ordered two small plates each and shared plus one dessert each and shared. Favorites: cazuela de coliflor, tamal en cazuela, camarones al Ajillo, and the empanadas. The big hit for dessert was the crepes.

data.title: A gem in Waltham!
data.text: Extraordinarily delicious Cuban food and small plates.  Brunch, lunch, and dinner here are all amazing.  The Remolacha is dream-worthy, the Tamal en Cazuela is richly delicious, and the Tortilla Española is savory and filling.  Ask for the empanada of the day!  Every item on the menu is prepared beautifully, and the coffee selection is excellent.  The atmosphere is enchanting and the staff are so friendly and professional.  I love this restaurant.

data.title: dinner with friends
data.text: This place is really, really good! I have being there plenty of times and never had a complaint. the food is very authentic. the owner/chef is cuban and has the right touch of flavors. all their dishes are delicious and the serving is just enough plus a little more. the appetizers are absolutely amazing! the yuca frita mmmmm and the plantains with guacamole oh good lord! we had to order 2 it was so good. the desserts are very, very good. you have to go hungry so you can try everything. they dont have the liquor license yet but you dont miss it. the restaurant is big and clean. the staff is super friendly!

data.title: Wonderful food, but...
data.text:
This small restaurant on Main St. (Route 20) is very Cuban in decor and atmosphere (given that I've never been to Cuba!). We were with another couple, and everything we ordered was delicious. The place is small and probably at the limit of how many people can get comfortably seated. The only negative is the noise factor: with all the wood, ceramic tile and metal ceiling, it really is very difficult to carry on a conversation. The service was a little on the slow side, but our waiter was reasonably attentive and the food was worth the wait. We DID have to wait what felt like a VERY long time to get the bill, which is always annoying to me. But again, the overall dining experience was above average, given my comments above.

BTW: I wish Trip Advisor would change/modify their ratings: poor, below average, average, above average, excellent. I would rate Gustavo overall at above average. Go for the food, put up with the rest.

data.title: Intimate Setting, Delicious dishes to share with each to other!
data.text:
The Restaurant is small but comfortable. I suggest you make a reservation!
It was a great fun to try the numerous Cuban dishes this Restaurants Menu offered. 
You are provided the option to order a large dish ( eat yourself or share) or many small tasteful dishes.  We had great fun tasting the variety of small dishes offered.

data.title: Good tapas but no beer?
data.text:
Four small plates served as entrees. Especially liked the beet salad and creamy polenta with pork. Shared two desserts--traditional flan, and vanilla ice cream with an amazing espresso and chocolate sauce. We were disappointed that we couldn't accompany this innovative, delicious Cuban cuisine with a beer or glass of sangria. We'll look forward to returning when the place gets a liquor license. 

beer or glass of sangria and the restaurant has no liquor license. Sad! We'll definitely come back when they get one!

data.title: Amazing Food!
data.text: We recently discovered Gustazo and we love it! Our brunch was so, so delicious. I had the smoked salmon open-faced sandwich and it combined every flavor I love! My fiancé had one of the pork belly brunch dishes and he loved it, except the pork belly was too crispy. We went back for dinner and the small plates were awesome. Especially the squash fritters with goat cheese mouse, omg. The mango-glazed salmon was excellent and the seafood stew was great except I got many little shell pieces in it, and it became very salty when mixed together. I would order a different fish next time. Overall, we will be coming back here with more people because it's delicious! (By the way, they should get their liquor license! I want cocktails with my Cuban food!)

data.title: Oh Wow! Absolutely Delicious!
data.text: This is one of the BEST meals we have had in quite a while, possibly top 10 ever.  We were given a friendly greeting when we arrived for lunch and promptly seated.  The dining room is beautifully decorated with a copper ceiling, Moroccan lanterns and a full wall covered in authentic (though reduced) Cuban movie posters, the tables covered with authentic Cuban newspaper clippings (in laminate).  It is utterly cool, and totally takes you to another place and time-lunchcation? Our server was excellent, friendly (but not too), helpful (but not pushy), attentive and efficient. The place was packed and she was initially the only server but it always seemed that we were only one of a couple tables for which she was responsible.  She offered suggestions when asked, guiding our choices with skill. On the servers suggestion, we started with the recent menu addition & perfect for summer, Garbanzos con Feta. It is both a delight for the eyes and the mouth. It is a cool salad of garbanzo beans, sofrito, feta cheese, & fresh mangos in a lime-cumin sauce.  It is a taste bud pleasing combination.  The richness of the beans and cheese, played well with the sweetness of the mango and then the lime jumped in and finished every bite off with a tang. I am salivating just writing this.  The Soup du Jour was a Country Lentil with carrots and chorizo, rustic and hearty.  Next came the day Empanadas, one of today's specials was beef and it was pure flaky, meaty goodness. The Frita Cubana is a burger with Spanish chorizo, Gruyere cheese, green leaf, aioli, tomato, caramel iced onions and crispy julienned potatoes on brioche, a safer bet for the less adventurous. It was delicious and messy.  Pavo is a Cuban take on a turkey BLT, with guava marmalade (at this point I was sold!), usually with goat cheese mousse but I opted for Gruyere and at the servers suggestion, had it on multigrain bread.  The sandwich is briefly grilled to obtain cross-hatch marks, but remains a cool sandwich. It is a very nice sandwich, the thick cut crisp bacon & guava marmalade adding something special, however, despite it being very good, there are many better, more "traditional" choices. Saving the best sandwich for last, the Cubano did not disappoint. A totally pleasing combination of slow roasted pork, smoked ham, Dijon, pickles, pimenton dulce aioli & Gruyere cheese and a baguette all pressed to perfection. The ingredients meld together, encased in a perfectly crisped baguette. I will never eat a Cubano anywhere else, they have reached perfection, so why seek disappointment? Totally stuffed (& we packed 1/2 of each sandwich to go) we could not pass on dessert. Cafe Bombon (a layer of sweetened condensed milk covered by a shot of espresso and topped with steamed milk is a rich, smooth cup of happiness. The guys both chose the Pudin de Pan (seared bread pudding topped with almond brittle and mocha almond ice cream (my hubby hates coffee and missed this part when reading the menu, however the ice cream had no coffee flavor, more Sweet Cream ice cream with a slight chocolate finish, very nice) drizzled with creme de vie.  They should have split one order. As you can see from the photos, there were 2 generous slices of the bread pudding topped with a tennis ball scoop of the ice cream. It is not your usual bread pudding, be thankful, usual is boring and not nearly as tasty. However, and pay attention!!! If you are broke or not hungry, skip straight to the Churros con Chocolate (& you might even skip the chocolate). These are not your state fair or convenience store Churros, in fact they are not even in the same family. A serving is 4, 1/4 pound hot dog sized Churros served with a pot of rich thick chocolate sauce (enough to share for 2 or 4 who don't dig dessert, is such people exist, and if they do, they are suspect in my book). These Churros are things of fantasy-light, airy, tender, delicate, & crisp, doused in cinnamon sugar. The chocolate is good, but it tends to mask the delicate Churros and you would be a total fool to do that.  Just eat the sauce with a spoon and be done with it.  It is dense and milk chocolatey, but too overwhelming for these delights from heaven. If you cannot tell, I am totally in love with this place and cannot wait to go back for dinner, there are SO many amazing sounding dishes!  I will be back however, and VERY soon. Now, what are YOU waiting for?

data.title: Great dinner with lots of flavor
data.text: I had the shrimp, squash blossoms and cauliflower. Cauliflower was my favorite with cheese, smoked paprika and pistachios! Wonderful flavored.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: We had the empanada, guacamole, ensalada de frijoles, and the tamale (Cuban style).  Portions are tapas style, and easily shareable. Service was quick and friendly. Excellent food presentation, decor and atmosphere. Overall, really enjoyed our meal (especially the plantain chips!).

data.title: Super addition to Waltham
data.text: We went to Gustavo's for lunch and had a super meal. The best plantain fries w dip. Our favorite sandwich was a turkey, the salmon was very good, also. Nicely decorated; we enjoyed the old Cuban newspapers on the table. Very attentive server.

data.title: Extremely HOT & HUMID without AC
data.text: Food menu is good with little option. Service is excellent. But, food comes very late. We were there on a recent hot Saturday evening. There was no functioning AC or HVAC service. It was extremely unpleasant to sit and wait for long, long time in a windowless place like sitting in a boiler room. Waltham city health official should look into this. I do think a restaurant should not be allowed to operate like this unhealthy condition.

data.title: Interesting food & venue
data.text: My friend and I met for dinner. It was quite loud at 6p when I entered so I asked for a table where we could talk and the hostess took me to the back which was great. Cute, old fashioned decor. The waiter asked if we had been there and then explained the menu - small or large plates. Very nice. We had six small plates. The tostones were a bit dry and almost burned, sauce was great. Ceviche was okay, some pieces were very chewy. I was disappointed. Empanadas, shrimp, cauliflower casserole good. The Spanish tortilla was good, could use more flavor. A nice experience all in all.

data.title: Food and service excellent
data.text: Okay, definitely four and a half. A varied menu - something for everyone from the pork-eater to the vegetarian. Clean cooking, great atmosphere, very good service. We were out-of-towners wandering in for lunch, and we can't wait to have a reason to be back in Waltham to go there again. Ample lunch for two was twenty-six bucks. Incredibly reasonable for the quality.
